subject: Re: [junit] Problems
msgSnippet: Marc: You use the -jar option, but you specify no .jar. This cannot work. The error message is telling you, I can t find junit.swingui.TestRunner.zip! Of
messageBody:
Marc:

You use the -jar option, but you specify no .jar. This cannot work. The
error message is telling you, "I can't find
junit.swingui.TestRunner.zip!" Of course not. There isn't one.

Please read the documentation that accompanies JUnit or, if junit.jar is
already on your system CLASSPATH, simply do not use the -jar switch.

Further, read up on the -jar switch in your local JDK documentation so
you can better understand what it does.

Thanks,
JBR.

Marc Woolfson wrote:

> I don't know what's going wrong, but having installed junit and
> setting the classpath variables correctly, I get the following
> response when I run
>
> "java -jar junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests"
>
> from the junit3.7 directory:
>
> Exception in thread "main" java.util.zip.ZipException: The system
> cannot find the file specified
> at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
> at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
> at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
> at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
>
> I think it must be the junit.jar file which cannot be found, but it
> _is_ in the classpath correctly...
>
> Cheers for your help... I need it!
>
> Marc Woolfson
> CSc Student
>
